Hm.. so as far as I can see a monospaced font is desired, but the issue was that the default on Ubuntu was too big, and `< 1em` doesn't work, right?

Maybe it would be possible to retrieve the default font size and use this, or an adjusted size based on this size, for the stylesheet, assuming the default size equals `1em`?

E.g.:

``` c++
// 1.0 em of default font:
QFont().pointSize()

/

I also like the monospace look in Ubuntu.

But I think this is controversial (IIRC there are also HiDPI issues) and would recommend to address it in a different PR.
It is difficult, because this PR migrates the look from bad to less bad. But once finally solved (using proper font), it is required anyway, so ACK.\n
I think this looks fine. I don't think monospace/fixed is necessary, and I remember some  problems with those in the past.\n

I think it's slightly unexpected for this to be part of the responsibility of a function called `HtmlEscape`. Especially to do this only on fMultiLine - there's nothing inherently multiline about replacing spaces.\nIf this is still necessary with monospace - maybe add a separate flag for this step?\n

Related: I suppose that changing the spaces to non-breaking ones cause problems when pasting the output into a json file and trying to parse it with a json parser? E.g. according to [RFC4627](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc4627.txt), `%xa0` is not a valid whitespace character:

```
      ws = *(
                %x20 /              ; Space
                %x09 /              ; Horizontal tab
Can we achieve the same, non-collapsing spaces, using css' whitespace property? http://www.w3schools.com/cssref/pr_text_white-space.asp  . Or is this not supported by Qt?\n
